description: Layered with marinara sauce and three kinds of cheese, this hot dip tastes just like pizza.
headline: Easy, Cheesy Hot Pizza Dip
name: Easy, Cheesy Hot Pizza Dip
recipeIngredient: 4 ounces Parmesan cheese, finely grated (about 1 cup), divided
6 ounces low-moisture mozzarella cheese, shredded (about 1 1/2 cups), divided
Serving options: sliced baguette, toast rounds, pita chips, flatbreads, crackers, bagel chips, or tortilla chips

recipeInstructions.text: Cut 8 ounces cream cheese into small cubes, place in a 9-inch pie plate, and let sit at room temperature until softened, about 1 hour.
Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 350oF. Meanwhile, shred 6 ounces mozzarella cheese (about 1 1/2 cups). Finely grate 4 ounces Parmesan cheese (about 1 cup).

Add 1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning to the cream cheese, stir to combine with a rubber spatula, and spread into an even layer. Sprinkle evenly with 3/4 cup of the mozzarella, followed by 1/2 cup of the Parmesan. Pour 1 cup pizza or marinara sauce over the cheeses and spread into an even layer. Sprinkle with the remaining 3/4 cup mozzarella and 1/2 cup Parmesan. Place 20 pepperoni slices in an even layer over the cheese if using.
Bake until heated through and the cheese is melted and bubbling, about 20 minutes. Let rest 5 to 10 minutes before serving. Serve warm.

video.description:
Add a hot, cheesy dip to your party spread and it's guaranteed to be a total hit. Make a cheesy dip layered with marinara and three kinds of cheese that tastes just like pizza (bonus points if you serve it with garlic bread!), and be prepared for everyone to be talking about it for months. And of course, they'll be asking you to make it for every party and gathering from here on out.
